name: UIViewControllerInteractiveTransitioning
desc: A set of methods that enable an object (such as a navigation controller) to drive a view controller transition.

items.name: func startInteractiveTransition(UIViewControllerContextTransitioning)
items.desc: Called when the system needs to set up the interactive portions of a view controller transition and start the animations.

items.name: var wantsInteractiveStart: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the transition is interactive when it starts.

items.name: var completionCurve: UIView.AnimationCurve
items.desc: Called when the system needs the animation completion curve for an interactive view controller transition.

items.name: var completionSpeed: CGFloat
items.desc: Called when the system needs the speed at which to complete an interactive transition, after the interactive portion is finished.
